intro: Silene elisabethae, commonly known as the Elisabeth's campion, is a rare flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Pyrenees. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Silene elisabethae is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in small, isolated populations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
